intro: Calceolaria zapatilla, commonly known as the Mexican slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are often violet or purple, with intricate patterns that attract specific pollinators. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains rare in the wild.
